{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3658283,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:02:46.535Z","cooked":"

Our team does not have a CANivore, but some people are lobbying to get one, as part of a push for more Krakens, etc. However, if I understand correctly, the new SystemCore will have 5 CAN-FD ports, and it is only 1 year away.

So, what do people think? Is it worth getting a CANivore for 1 year of competition? Does, in fact, the new control system make the CANivore somewhat obsolete, or will there still be advantages to using it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:02:46.535Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":465,"readers_count":464,"score":403.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Paul Rensing","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25118,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2877 LigerBots Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/1","custom_user_title":"FRC 2877 LigerBots Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3658303,"name":"Jimmy McCosker","username":"Jimmyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:19:14.860Z","cooked":"

I think there will still be advantages to using it (now and even post-SystemCore). CTRE‚Äôs swerve generator is quite a good tool, with improved odometry, simulation, and reduced CAN utilization by running your swerve on a separate bus. I am confident that CTRE‚Äôs swerve generator will support SystemCore, but this has not been confirmed as of yet, IIRC.

Speaking of separate busses, you can run your mechanisms on the RIO bus, and your swerve on the CANivore bus. Making troubleshooting a breeze.

Also I think the CANivore is the only USB to CAN device in FRC‚Ä¶ whatever that‚Äôs worth.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:19:14.860Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":456,"readers_count":455,"score":146.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Jimmy McCosker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9496AM | Programming, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/2","custom_user_title":"9496AM | Programming, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658330,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:50:31.466Z","cooked":"

I can‚Äôt imagine 5 CAN-FD busses won‚Äôt be enough if the RIO bus alone is fine for most teams.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:50:31.466Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":416,"readers_count":415,"score":223.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/3","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658335,"name":"","username":"httpmaster","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/ebca7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:58:00.881Z","cooked":"

I think in 2027 the CANivore‚Äôs main use will be for testbenches without a full SystemCore

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:58:00.881Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":398,"readers_count":397,"score":94.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67339,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1836 team captain"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/4","custom_user_title":"1836 team captain","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658341,"name":"MetabolicCloth","username":"MetabolicCloth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/metaboliccloth/{size}/9335_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T21:06:51.231Z","cooked":"

The value proposition for a separate USB based CAN bus goes down dramatically with the introduction of 5 CAN busses on the SystemCore, why risk additional HW failure points (USB connection to CANivore) when there‚Äôs now 5 integrated. The only real justification would be if CTRE does not allow the CAN FD features of the CANivore to be accessible on the SystemCore.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T21:06:51.231Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":387,"readers_count":386,"score":137.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"MetabolicCloth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52943,"username":"Jimmyy","name":"Jimmy McCosker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658342,"name":"Robertson Robotics","username":"s3529","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T21:11:19.928Z","cooked":"
MetabolicCloth:

The only real justification would be if CTRE does not allow the CAN FD features of the CANivore to be accessible on the SystemCore.

Edit: Nevermind, it was confirmed in the previous blog post:

5x CAN-FD ports using Weidmuller wire-to-board connectors

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T21:12:53.562Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":363,"readers_count":362,"score":87.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Robertson Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://community.firstinspires.org/march-updates-on-the-future-robot-controller","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Updates on the Future Robot Controller","clicks":32}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24506,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658436,"name":"","username":"Spaceman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T00:31:46.638Z","cooked":"

Obviously each swerve module and mechanism needs its own can bus

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T00:31:46.638Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":95.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28014,"username":"bobbysq","name":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60754,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658443,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T00:41:36.782Z","cooked":"

Also, I suspect some legacy device might not get FD support because of the hardware used in them and they may not work well with devices talking CAN FD thus require a dedicated non-FD bus to operate.

for example‚Ä¶

REV Robotics 2024 / 2025 General Forum
Ok, so The Flex motor controller has the hardware to support CAN-FD‚Ä¶ The MAX does not. Not great, but you can‚Äôt use a Flex motor controller with a NEO 1.1 or a NEO 550 right now. (SPARK Flex Dock | REV ION Brushless - ‚ÄúComing Soon‚Äù) So we‚Äôre really looking at a complete break in terms of backwards compatibility (pending the Dock which I thought was teased last year) with the v1.1 and 550 motors. (Nevermind the Flex is $100 + dock ($?) which may leave it with an unreasonable price (comparatively‚Ä¶

and SN65HVD230 + STM32F103C8T in LaserCAN does not seems to have FD support.

and MCP2515, ESP32 TWAI all don‚Äôt support CAN-FD

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T00:49:27.283Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":298,"readers_count":297,"score":109.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/rev-robotics-2024-2025/471083/42","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"REV Robotics 2024 / 2025","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60754,"username":"Spaceman","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a5b964/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/8","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658452,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T01:00:11.361Z","cooked":"

From what I remember CAN-FD is backwards compatible with CAN 2.0, just meaning all devices on that bus will be running as CAN 2.0.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T01:00:11.361Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":119.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":66330,"username":"NathanZhou","name":"Nathan Zhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/9","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658457,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T01:07:40.602Z","cooked":"
MetabolicCloth:

The only real justification would be if CTRE does not allow the CAN FD features of the CANivore to be accessible on the SystemCore.

If they don‚Äôt allow that, they don‚Äôt deserve your money. I would hope for all CTRE charges for their hardware and software, that they would be able to properly support the control system hardware instead of requiring the use of an obsolete device.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T01:07:40.602Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":98.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/10","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658460,"name":"Brian Rozmierski","username":"bdaroz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bdaroz/{size}/128636_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T01:13:20.176Z","cooked":"

I suspect teams would be wide to keep all CAN 2.0 only (non-CAN-FD) devices separated on one of the CAN busses on SystemCore. One, to reduce the device count on a bus, and thus the number of junctions on a bus, and therefore, in theory, increase reliability. Two, to prevent CAN-FD-capable devices from falling back to CAN 2.0.

From a CSA perspective, I‚Äôm looking forward to the multiple busses as it should reduce the number of ‚Äúuh no, CAN dead == bot dead‚Äù inctances.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T01:13:20.176Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":116.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Brian Rozmierski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Volunteer / Former 5881 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/11","custom_user_title":"FRC Volunteer / Former 5881 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658494,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T02:07:08.726Z","cooked":"

this is really devices dependent. Every MCU / controller / transceiver handle things a little bit differently and all MCU would have it‚Äôs own firmware which handle things a bit differently. For example, what if a bus is running CAN-FD and a non-FD device powered during FD traffic, than other device is trying to send FD frame‚Ä¶ there is just too many posibility. Some device might be programmed to detect bus type upon startup and are unable to fallback.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T02:08:47.743Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":41952,"username":"AdamF","name":"Adam Fleming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/12","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658497,"name":"","username":"AvocadoPeel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T02:11:00.478Z","cooked":"

I imagine some of the ‚Äúctre secret sauce‚Äù features like time-synced status signals would still only be available on the canivore, but other features that only require the higher packet size (like DynamicMotionMagic) being able to run on the SystemCore CAN FD bus.

I would not be upset if this is the case

prensing:

Does, in fact, the new control system make the CANivore somewhat obsolete

To be honest, that‚Äôs up to CTRE. If CTRE is willing to work with Limelight and FIRST and they share their secret sauce, then the CANivore will become obsolete.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-06-20T03:37:25.833Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":222,"readers_count":221,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503391,"topic_slug":"canivore-and-2027-control-system","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/canivore-and-2027-control-system/503391/16","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658549,"name":"Robertson Robotics","username":"s3529","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T04:25:54.000Z","cooked":"

Best case scenario, ‚Äúall of this just works‚Äù

Worst case scenario, you get 5 CAN bus ports on the System Core because you need one bus connected to a CTRE CANivore, one connected to a REV MaxCAN, one connected to the Redux Canand-FD, one connected to the ThriftyFD, and one to the AM-FD4U if you want to unlock the ‚Äúfull potential‚Äù of your robot.

I would still be upset. The SystemCore is a much more ‚Äúnormal‚Äù device being developed in the present day by FRC people. I sure hope CTRE is involved at least in some degree. I imagine compared to the RIO with all of it‚Äôs NI/FPGA weirdness the SystemCore should be easier to add these features to. I‚Äôm not sure how they do the time sync (it seems like they could send a Remote Frame to request data or send something to sync clocks with any CAN adapter?), but hardware message timestamps are certainly a very common feature of CAN interfaces. Maybe the missing link is that the CANivore processor can queue up TX messages to send with precision timing?
